title: U.S. Space Force certifies ULA’s Vulcan rocket to begin launching national security missions
summary: The conclusion of certification closes out a process that began in September 2016 and saw the government closely track the development of Vulcan alongside United Launch Alliance. Its first National Security Space Launch mission is targeting liftoff over the summer.

title: ULA’s Vulcan Wins Certification for National Security Space Launches
summary: The U.S. Space Force certified the United Launch Alliance’s (ULA’s) Vulcan rocket today, making it eligible to launch national security satellites. Two successful test flights are needed to win certification. […]

title: NASA’s X-59 Completes ‘Cruise Control’ Engine Speed Hold Test
summary: The team behind NASA’s X-59 completed another critical ground test in March, ensuring the quiet supersonic aircraft will be able to maintain a specific speed during operation. title: At long last, the Space Force has certified the Vulcan rocket
summary: US Space Force to United Launch Alliance: "I have been and always shall be your friend."

title: Space Force certifies Vulcan for national security launches
summary:
The U.S. Space Force has certified United Launch Alliance’s Vulcan Centaur rocket, allowing that vehicle to conduct national security missions.
